Jaishankar's 'China guru' dig at Rahul</title><description><![CDATA[External Affairs Minister Jaishankar strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi in the Rajya Sabha, labeling him a "China-guru" and implying his understanding of China stemmed from Olympic invitations and private lessons from Chinese diplomats. Jaishankar defended his China visit, asserting transparency and contrasting it with alleged secret meetings by others during the 2008 Beijing Olympics.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/were-you-sleeping-in-history-class-jaishankars-china-guru-dig-at-rahul-slams-gandhi-family/articleshow/122997913.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/were-you-sleeping-in-history-class-jaishankars-china-guru-dig-at-rahul-slams-gandhi-family/articleshow/122997913.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 17:19:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="51504" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122998080,imgsize-51504.cms"/></item><item><title>India Champions boycott Pakistan once again</title><description><![CDATA[India Champions will not play Pakistan in the World Championship of Legends semi-final. The team had earlier refused to play Pakistan in the league stage. A key sponsor, EaseMyTrip, withdrew support for the semi-final. They cited concerns about normalising relations with a country that promotes terrorism. India Champions had a mixed tournament, losing matches to South Africa, Australia, and England.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/india-boycott-pakistan-once-again-refuse-to-play-them-in-wcl-semifinal/articleshow/122996884.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/news/india-boycott-pakistan-once-again-refuse-to-play-them-in-wcl-semifinal/articleshow/122996884.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 17:08:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="46554" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122997051,imgsize-46554.cms"/></item><item><title>'They rained bullets, you served them biryani': Nadda slams Cong in RS</title><description><![CDATA[JP Nadda criticized the Congress party's handling of past terror attacks. He contrasted the UPA government's response with the current government's actions. Nadda highlighted specific attacks and the perceived lack of action under the previous administration. He praised Prime Minister Modi's strong stance against terrorism. Nadda emphasized the importance of political will in combating terrorism.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/they-rained-bullets-you-served-them-biryani-nadda-attacks-congress-slams-upa-inaction/articleshow/122996652.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/they-rained-bullets-you-served-them-biryani-nadda-attacks-congress-slams-upa-inaction/articleshow/122996652.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 16:39:56 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="64590" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122997176,imgsize-64590.cms"/></item><item><title>OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns: People use ChatGPT as a therapist, talk all personal stuff</title><description><![CDATA[OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions against sharing sensitive personal information with ChatGPT, highlighting the lack of legal confidentiality. He points out that unlike therapists or doctors, conversations with AI are not protected, potentially creating privacy risks in legal situations. Altman suggests users should seek clarity on privacy before extensively using ChatGPT.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/openai-ceo-sam-altman-warns-people-use-chatgpt-as-a-therapist-life-coach-and-talk-all-personal-stuff-and-that-is-huge-problem-because-/articleshow/122992620.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/openai-ceo-sam-altman-warns-people-use-chatgpt-as-a-therapist-life-coach-and-talk-all-personal-stuff-and-that-is-huge-problem-because-/articleshow/122992620.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 13:23:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TIMESOFINDIA.COM</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="37262" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122992654,imgsize-37262.cms"/></item><item><title>Tragedy in Ladakh: Boulder crushes army vehicle, 2 personnel killed</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/tragedy-in-ladakh-boulder-strikes-army-vehicle-2-personnel-killed/articleshow/122998860.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/tragedy-in-ladakh-boulder-strikes-army-vehicle-2-personnel-killed/articleshow/122998860.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 18:02:25 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="114754" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122998904,imgsize-114754.cms"/></item><item><title>India-UK ink defence pact to develop complex weapons, jet engines</title><description><![CDATA[India and the United Kingdom have unveiled a 10-year defence roadmap. The focus is on boosting cooperation and strengthening security ties. Both nations will work on co-development and joint research. They will also focus on innovation across defence technologies. Maritime security and military ties will also be strengthened. The roadmap aims for regional stability and a rules-based international order.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-uk-defence-ties-pact-inked-to-develop-complex-weapons-jet-warship-engines-vision-2035-roadmap/articleshow/122998335.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-uk-defence-ties-pact-inked-to-develop-complex-weapons-jet-warship-engines-vision-2035-roadmap/articleshow/122998335.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 17:41:12 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1205545" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122998406,imgsize-1205545.cms"/></item><item><title>Astronomer CEO Pete De Joy: To all of our employees at Astronomer; it's time for ...</title><description><![CDATA[Following a viral video involving its former CEO, Astronomer's current CEO, Pete DeJoy, has lauded his team's resilience. Amidst the controversy, the company hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson, releasing a humorous promotional clip. DeJoy expressed gratitude for his employees' dedication and thanked Maximum Effort for their work with Paltrow.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/astronomer-ceo-pete-de-joy-to-all-of-our-employees-at-astronomer-its-time-for-us-now-to-/articleshow/122967954.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/astronomer-ceo-pete-de-joy-to-all-of-our-employees-at-astronomer-its-time-for-us-now-to-/articleshow/122967954.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 11:36:14 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="11686" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122967948,imgsize-11686.cms"/></item><item><title>Watch: Patients wade through ankle-deep water as rain floods Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital</title><description><![CDATA[Torrential rains paralyzed Delhi, causing severe waterlogging at Safdarjung Hospital, where patients waded through flooded wards. In a tragic incident, a woman and her son, new to the city for work, died when a weakened boundary wall collapsed on their shelter in Sehgal Colony. Residents claim construction and tree cutting contributed to the wall's instability, leading to the fatal collapse.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/delhis-safdarjung-hospital-flooded-after-heavy-rains-patients-wade-through-ankle-deep-water-watch/articleshow/122998471.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/delhis-safdarjung-hospital-flooded-after-heavy-rains-patients-wade-through-ankle-deep-water-watch/articleshow/122998471.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 17:38:31 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="648457" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122998455,imgsize-648457.cms"/></item><item><title>'Feels like fiction': Jaya turns 'film critic' during Op Sindoor debate</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/feels-like-fiction-jaya-bachchan-turns-film-critic-in-operation-sindoor-debate-congratulates-centre-for-writers-who-coin-grand-names/articleshow/122996523.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/feels-like-fiction-jaya-bachchan-turns-film-critic-in-operation-sindoor-debate-congratulates-centre-for-writers-who-coin-grand-names/articleshow/122996523.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 16:13:33 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1197048" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122996505,imgsize-1197048.cms"/></item><item><title>TCS layoffs: Ex-Tech Mahindra CEO quotes Sholay; CP Gurnani’s message sparks debate</title><description><![CDATA[Amidst TCS layoffs, CP Gurnani urges the Indian tech industry to move beyond headcount obsession and embrace outcome-based models. He emphasizes a shift from the traditional pyramid structure, advocating for enhanced productivity, specialized skills, and advanced technological capabilities. Experts suggest that upskilling and reskilling are crucial for tech professionals in this evolving landscape.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/tcs-layoffs-former-tech-mahindra-ceo-cp-gurnani-quotes-sholay-line-and-sends-a-message-to-techies/articleshow/122970365.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/technology/tech-news/tcs-layoffs-former-tech-mahindra-ceo-cp-gurnani-quotes-sholay-line-and-sends-a-message-to-techies/articleshow/122970365.cms</guid><pubDate>Tue, 29 Jul 2025 13:11:01 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI TECH DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="30336" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122970349,imgsize-30336.cms"/></item><item><title>Friendship Day: Wishes, messages, quotes, captions, to make your buddy feel special</title><description><![CDATA[International Friendship Day, established by the UN in 2011 and observed on July 30th, celebrates the cherished bonds of friendship. It's an opportunity to express gratitude and acknowledge the value friends bring to our lives. The day is marked by sharing heartfelt wishes, quotes, and messages that highlight the importance of loyalty, support, and shared memories.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/relationships/family/75-international-friendship-day-wishes-quotes-messages-images-gtreetings-gifs-whatsapp-status-captions-images-to-make-your-dear-buddy-feel-special-today/articleshow/122997210.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/relationships/family/75-international-friendship-day-wishes-quotes-messages-images-gtreetings-gifs-whatsapp-status-captions-images-to-make-your-dear-buddy-feel-special-today/articleshow/122997210.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 16:58:18 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI LIFESTYLE DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="55470" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122997295,imgsize-55470.cms"/></item><item><title>Jasprit Bumrah IN or OUT? Shubman Gill gives crucial update</title><description><![CDATA[Will Jasprit Bumrah play in the crucial fifth Test against England at The Oval? Skipper Shubman Gill remained tight-lipped, citing a green wicket as a factor. Bumrah's form dipped in the drawn Manchester Test, with his pace noticeably reduced. Despite this, he remains a key bowler, tied with Siraj for most wickets.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-jasprit-bumrah-in-or-out-shubman-gill-gives-crucial-update-on-star-pacer-ahead-of-5th-test/articleshow/122998184.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-jasprit-bumrah-in-or-out-shubman-gill-gives-crucial-update-on-star-pacer-ahead-of-5th-test/articleshow/122998184.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 17:26:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAHIL MALHOTRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="35700" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122998281,imgsize-35700.cms"/></item><item><title>'Some people uncomfortable with history': Jaishankar slams Cong in RS over IWT</title><description><![CDATA[External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Rajya Sabha on Operation Sindoor, following the Pahalgam terror attack. Jaishankar refuted claims of US mediation for a ceasefire between India and Pakistan.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/some-people-are-uncomfortable-with-history-jaishankar-slams-congress-in-rajya-sabha-over-iwt-top-quotes/articleshow/122993509.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/some-people-are-uncomfortable-with-history-jaishankar-slams-congress-in-rajya-sabha-over-iwt-top-quotes/articleshow/122993509.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 14:17:38 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="915816" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122993606,imgsize-915816.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG | 'Uneven gaps': Stokes slams scheduling after injury rules him out</title><description><![CDATA[Ben Stokes' shoulder injury sidelines him for the final Test against India, prompting him to criticise the series' demanding schedule and inconsistent gaps between matches. He addressed the handshake controversy and praised the series' competitive spirit, while also commenting on the Oval's seam-friendly pitch.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-gruelling-series-uneven-gaps-ben-stokes-slams-scheduling-after-injury-rules-him-out-of-oval-decider/articleshow/122996749.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-gruelling-series-uneven-gaps-ben-stokes-slams-scheduling-after-injury-rules-him-out-of-oval-decider/articleshow/122996749.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 16:26:26 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>SAHIL MALHOTRA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="24914" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122996829,imgsize-24914.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: Stokes out! Ollie Pope will take over the captaincy, while Ollie Pope will be the stand-in captain. Jacob Bethell, Gus Atkinson, Jamie Overton, and Josh Tongue are included, aiming to bolster the team's performance at The Oval.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-playing-xi-england-make-blockbuster-changes-to-playing-xi-for-test/articleshow/122995599.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-playing-xi-england-make-blockbuster-changes-to-playing-xi-for-test/articleshow/122995599.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 15:41:32 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="38984" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122995634,imgsize-38984.cms"/></item><item><title>Tsunami disrupts marine life: Hundreds of sea lions flee powerful waves – Watch</title><description><![CDATA[A powerful 8.8-magnitude earthquake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami warnings across the Pacific, sending Steller sea lions fleeing to higher ground as waves crashed into the coast. While waves reached up to 4 meters in Kamchatka and impacted Japan, Alaska, and the US West Coast, little major damage was reported, though some injuries and flooding occurred.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/tsunami-disrupts-marine-life-hundreds-of-sea-lions-flee-powerful-waves-after-russia-earthquake-watch/articleshow/122993677.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/tsunami-disrupts-marine-life-hundreds-of-sea-lions-flee-powerful-waves-after-russia-earthquake-watch/articleshow/122993677.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 14:32:28 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="4188498" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122994113,imgsize-4188498.cms"/></item><item><title>'Joyous day': PM hails return of Buddha's relics; back in India after 127 yrs</title><description><![CDATA[Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the return of the sacred Piprahwa relics of Lord Buddha to India after 127 years. Discovered in 1898, the relics were taken abroad during the colonial period. The government intervened after the relics appeared in an international auction, emphasizing India's dedication to preserving its cultural heritage and its deep connection to Buddhism.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/joyous-day-for-heritage-pm-modi-hails-return-of-buddhas-piprahwa-relics-back-in-country-after-127-years/articleshow/122995116.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/joyous-day-for-heritage-pm-modi-hails-return-of-buddhas-piprahwa-relics-back-in-country-after-127-years/articleshow/122995116.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 15:24:27 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1232004" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122995230,imgsize-1232004.cms"/></item><item><title>Bumrah OUT, Kuldeep and Arshdeep IN: India's predicted playing XI vs England</title><description><![CDATA[India and England will play the series-deciding final Test at the Kennington Oval. England leads the series 2-1. India aims to level the series. Dhruv Jurel will replace the injured Rishabh Pant. Ben Stokes is out due to injury. Ollie Pope will captain England. England has made four changes to their team.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-out-kuldeep-yadav-and-arshdeep-singh-in-indias-predicted-playing-xi-for-5th-test-vs-england-at-the-oval/articleshow/122995990.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/jasprit-bumrah-out-kuldeep-yadav-and-arshdeep-singh-in-indias-predicted-playing-xi-for-5th-test-vs-england-at-the-oval/articleshow/122995990.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 15:57:53 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="40124" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122996079,imgsize-40124.cms"/></item><item><title>IND vs ENG: Ben Stokes breaks silence on handshake row: 'Let’s not focus...'</title><description><![CDATA[England captain Ben Stokes addressed the controversy surrounding his handshake offer to Indian batsmen Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar during the drawn Old Trafford Test. Stokes, who will miss the final Test due to injury, defended his offer, stating he didn't want to bowl his main bowlers.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-test-ben-stokes-breaks-silence-on-handshake-row-lets-not-focus-on-those-20-minutes/articleshow/122996639.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/cricket/india-tour-of-england/ind-vs-eng-test-ben-stokes-breaks-silence-on-handshake-row-lets-not-focus-on-those-20-minutes/articleshow/122996639.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 16:18:56 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="153864" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122996638,imgsize-153864.cms"/></item><item><title>Jake Paul’s MVP makes massive women’s boxing contracts with Shannon Courtenay & others</title><description><![CDATA[Most Valuable Promotions (MVP), led by Jake Paul, has signed five prominent female boxers, including four world champions, on July 29, 2025. The new signees are Shannon Courtenay, Jasmine Artiga, Desley Robinson, Yesica Nery Plata, and Sa’Rai Brown‑El. Filers must also provide detailed disclosures on TDS sections and deductions.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/financial-literacy/taxation/itr-3-live-for-online-filing-income-tax-form-covers-business-and-professional-income-earners-directors-and-traders-key-things-to-know-before-filing-for-ay-202526/articleshow/122991253.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/financial-literacy/taxation/itr-3-live-for-online-filing-income-tax-form-covers-business-and-professional-income-earners-directors-and-traders-key-things-to-know-before-filing-for-ay-202526/articleshow/122991253.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 12:58:35 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="150745" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122992171,imgsize-150745.cms"/></item><item><title>Another dog named Dogesh Babu’s residence certificate application raises eyebrows</title><description><![CDATA[A bizarre incident occurred in Bihar. The court questioned Varma's participation in the inquiry without initially contesting its validity. His counsel argued that the panel's removal suggestion violated constitutional principles, emphasizing the problematic precedent it would establish.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/your-conduct-does-not-inspire-confidence-sc-reserves-verdict-on-justice-yashwant-varmas-plea-what-the-top-court-said/articleshow/122991960.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/your-conduct-does-not-inspire-confidence-sc-reserves-verdict-on-justice-yashwant-varmas-plea-what-the-top-court-said/articleshow/122991960.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 13:21:27 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI NEWS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="15152" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122992519,imgsize-15152.cms"/></item><item><title>Microsoft restores IT service to Russia-backed Indian refinery after EU sanctions</title><description><![CDATA[Microsoft has restored IT services to Nayara Energy, an Indian oil refinery backed by Russia. A lawsuit was filed by Nayara Energy due to service suspension following EU sanctions. The sanctions have significantly impacted Nayara's operations, leading to reduced refinery activities. Microsoft confirmed the restoration of services after Nayara's lawyer informed a New Delhi court that the matter had been resolved.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/some-relief-for-nayara-microsoft-restores-it-services-to-russia-backed-indian-oil-refinery-us-company-abruptly-halted-operations-after-eu-sanctions/articleshow/122993612.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/some-relief-for-nayara-microsoft-restores-it-services-to-russia-backed-indian-oil-refinery-us-company-abruptly-halted-operations-after-eu-sanctions/articleshow/122993612.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 14:09:34 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="23572" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122993626,imgsize-23572.cms"/></item><item><title>Bank Holidays in August: On what days will banks be closed? Check list</title><description><![CDATA[August 2025 will see several bank holidays across India. Banks will be closed nationwide for Independence Day on August 15th. Various regional holidays, including Tendong Lho Rum Faat, Raksha Bandhan, Janmashtami, and Ganesh Chaturthi, will also lead to closures in specific states.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/bank-holidays-in-august-2025-on-what-days-will-banks-be-closed-check-state-wise-list/articleshow/122993185.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/bank-holidays-in-august-2025-on-what-days-will-banks-be-closed-check-state-wise-list/articleshow/122993185.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 13:55:47 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI BUSINESS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="81494" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122993204,imgsize-81494.cms"/></item><item><title>Typhoon Co-May makes landfall in China: Orange alert issued in Shanghai</title><description><![CDATA[Typhoon Co-May disrupted eastern China, making landfall in Zhoushan with 83 km/h winds, prompting mass evacuations of over 280,000 people. Shanghai faced flight cancellations, with over 640 flights grounded across its airports. Ferry services were halted, and speed limits were imposed. Simultaneously, a powerful earthquake off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula triggered tsunami alerts, later lifted, adding to the region's natural scare.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/china/typhoon-co-may-makes-landfall-in-china-orange-alert-issued-in-shanghai-over-280000-evacuated-flights-and-ferries-halted/articleshow/122992611.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/china/typhoon-co-may-makes-landfall-in-china-orange-alert-issued-in-shanghai-over-280000-evacuated-flights-and-ferries-halted/articleshow/122992611.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 13:54:58 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="3028232" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122993354,imgsize-3028232.cms"/></item><item><title>Flight passengers evacuate via emergency slides after smoke detected — Watch</title><description><![CDATA[A Turkish Airlines Boeing 777 was evacuated at Antalya Airport after smoke emerged from the landing gear following its arrival from Istanbul. Emergency teams advised the evacuation as a precautionary measure, and all passengers were safely evacuated without any injuries. Preliminary investigations suggest a faulty hydraulic pipe caused the smoke, and the aircraft is undergoing technical assessment.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/panic-at-turkish-airport-boeing-777-passengers-evacuate-via-emergency-slides-after-smoke-detected-watch/articleshow/122988682.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/panic-at-turkish-airport-boeing-777-passengers-evacuate-via-emergency-slides-after-smoke-detected-watch/articleshow/122988682.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 11:09:39 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="4152189" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122989845,imgsize-4152189.cms"/></item><item><title> 'Security protocol': Why Divya played World Cup-winning move inside empty venue</title><description><![CDATA[Divya Deshmukh made history by winning the FIDE Women's World Cup in Batumi. The 19-year-old defeated Grandmaster (GM) Koneru Humpy in a tense tie-break. Spectators were absent during the final moments due to FIDE regulations. Divya's victory marks a significant moment for Indian women's chess. She also became India’s 88th Grandmaster.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/chess/chess-security-protocol-why-divya-deshmukh-played-world-cup-winning-move-inside-empty-venue/articleshow/122990349.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/chess/chess-security-protocol-why-divya-deshmukh-played-world-cup-winning-move-inside-empty-venue/articleshow/122990349.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 11:38:20 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>JYOTIRMOY HALDER</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="57932" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122990360,imgsize-57932.cms"/></item><item><title>Ports destroyed, whales washed ashore: Tsunami hits Russian, Japanese coasts - Watch</title><description><![CDATA[A strong earthquake struck off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula. It triggered a large tsunami. Coastal areas faced evacuation. Submerged buildings and massive water drenching were seen. The quake's magnitude was 8.7. Tsunami waves reached up to 4 meters. Warnings issued for Japan, Hawaii, and other Pacific regions. People were asked to leave their homes. The earthquake was the strongest in decades.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/watch-tsunami-hits-russias-kamchatka-coast-after-8-7-earthquake-waves-up-to-4-metres-recorded/articleshow/122986495.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/europe/watch-tsunami-hits-russias-kamchatka-coast-after-8-7-earthquake-waves-up-to-4-metres-recorded/articleshow/122986495.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 30 Jul 2025 07:31:32 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="3434914" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-122988887,imgsize-3434914.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

      <description><![CDATA[The company posted a net profit of ₹2,007 crore, significantly beating the CNBC-TV18 poll estimate of ₹1,765 crore and more than doubling its profit from ₹918.6 crore in the same quarter last year. This strong performance highlights Tata Steel’s robust operational efficiency and strategic execution. Shares of Tata Steel Ltd ended at ₹161.35, down by ₹0.35 or 0.22% on the BSE.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[The Genius Act marks a turning point for stablecoins, offering them legal legitimacy and regulatory clarity. “This legitimisation of stablecoins is certainly going to give a huge boost,” says Eswar Prasad, Professor at Cornell University.       <description><![CDATA[SuperK plans to use its ₹100 crore Series B funding to deepen its presence in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka, rather than expanding nationwide. “We’re not trying to expand everywhere… the market we’re operating in already has immense depth,” said Neeraj Menta, Co-Founder of SuperK.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[No interim US-India trade deal yet; Indian exporters brace for 20-25% tariffs as August 1 deadline nears]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/world/india-us-trade-deal-delay-trump-tariffs-impact-exporters-19644819.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Indian exporters are gearing up for possible US tariffs of 20–25% as the August 1 deadline set by President Trump approaches without an interim trade deal. While the tariff uncertainty has stalled orders, industry leaders say Indian exporters remain competitively placed compared to rivals like Bangladesh and China. Exporters expect the tariffs to impact profit margins more than supply chains, with fresh orders likely once clarity emerges post-deadline. Trade talks are set to resume in August as both countries work toward a broader agreement.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[The India-UK Free Trade Agreement will open up new manufacturing opportunities for British firms in India and is expected to more than double bilateral trade to $120 billion over the next five years, said Sunil Bharti Mittal, Chairman of Bharti Enterprises. He highlighted the advantages of lower tariffs, smoother mobility, and deeper cooperation in sectors like defence, technology, and education as key outcomes of the deal.]]></description>

      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/tata-capital-ipo-valuation-raised-drhp-filing-19642326.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Sources say the company is likely to file its updated Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) as early as tomorrow or by the end of this week. Tata Capital plans to raise around $2 billion through the IPO, which is expected to launch in the first half of September this year. The IPO is being driven by a regulatory mandate.       <title><![CDATA[United Breweries Q1 net profit up but misses estimates; premium brands drive up volume]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/market/stocks/united-breweries-share-price-q1fy26-results-net-profit-revenue-ebitda-margin-miss-estimates-volume-growth-premiumisation-kingfisher-amstel-grande-19641527.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[United Breweries reported an 11% volume growth in Q1, driven by a 46% surge in its premium portfolio, resulting in estimated market share gains both overall and in the premium segment. Net sales rose 16%, supported by this volume growth along with pricing and premiumisation efforts. Shares of United Breweries Ltd ended at ₹2,040, up by ₹18, or 0.89% on the BSE.]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[At the operating level, EBITDA surged 32% YoY to ₹883 crore in the June quarter over ₹669 crore, beating the CNBC TV18 poll estimate of ₹831 crore.
